Posted By: DacenOctavio (6/10/2011 9:11:53 AM)

posts.post_content:
@Attract: Let's get a few things straight, here.  
  
1. Diabolic Tutor still requires you to pay the cost of the creature you search for. So while, yes, you can *search* for something bigger than 4 cmc, you're going to have to pay the extra.  
  
2. There are 3, maybe 4, creatures with 4 cmc that have beneficial "when you cast" triggers. Most triggers are ETB, so this whole point is thrown out the window as only ONE of those creatures is playable (*[Bloodbraid Elf](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodbraid Elf)*).  
  
3. Let's look at the numbers: With Fleshwrither, you pay a total of 7 mana for a 4 drop(4 for the Fleshwrither, 3 for the ability). With Tutor, you pay a total of **8** mana for a 4 drop(4 for the Tutor, 4 for the creature).  
  
4. "Keeps it a secret"??? Why on earth would *that* help?!? The comparison here is with permanents, not other spells. If we were discussing something like a counterspell, we would have a different story. With few exceptions(Flash comes to mind) the "secret" part is irre... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
We probably won't see this ability returning anythime soon. MaRo has stated that they don't want to pick Transmute up again because tutoring seeps a lot of fun from the game, so I don't see why this would be any different.  
It is fun, though. The graveyard-filling, morbid-triggering part is as good as the turoring.  
I'd be happier if it could search for any kind of permanent, though. You can never have too many ways to tutor a [Grave Pact](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grave Pact).
posts.html:
We probably won't see this ability returning anythime soon. MaRo has stated that they don't want to pick Transmute up again because tutoring seeps a lot of fun from the game, so I don't see why this would be any different.
It is fun, though. The graveyard-filling, morbid-triggering part is as good as the turoring.

Posted By: Lord_of_Tresserhorn (9/23/2011 3:29:05 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I'd like it better if transfigure gave the searched creature haste.   
Let's compare it to Diabolic Tutor, bear with me:   
  
Demonic Tutor:   
-Sorcery  
-Keeps search a secret  
-Not limited to 4 cc or creatures  
-Searched card is counter bait, but otherwise opponent cant deal with it yet.  
  
 Fleshwrither:  
-Sorcery (essentially)  
-Can serve as a weak attacker/blocker (though dying would defeat its purpose)  
-Ability doesn't allow "when you cast \_\_" abilities to trigger  
-Fills your graveyard with a creature, which is usually more helpful than a sorcery  
-Transfigured card is uncounterable, but opponent has more options of getting rid of your "tutor"  
  
I dunno, If it gave haste it would, I believe, put it more on par with diabolic tutor, giving it a surprise factor. After all, diabolic tutor is a "fixed" card anyway.  
Meh, 3/5
posts.html:
I'd like it better if transfigure gave the searched creature haste.
Let's compare it to Diabolic Tutor, bear with me:

Demonic Tutor:
-Sorcery
-Keeps search a secret
-Not limited to 4 cc or creatures
-Searched card is counter bait, but otherwise opponent cant deal with it yet.

Fleshwrither:
-Sorcery (essentially)
-Can serve as a weak attacker/blocker (though dying would defeat its purpose)
-Ability doesn't allow "when you cast __" abilities to trigger
-Fills your graveyard with a creature, which is usually more helpful than a sorcery
-Transfigured card is uncounterable, but opponent has more options of getting rid of your "tutor"

I dunno, If it gave haste it would, I believe, put it more on par with diabolic tutor, giving it a surprise factor. After all, diabolic tutor is a "fixed" card anyway.
Meh, 3/5
